What happens if you set "returntxtemplate" to true when sending a transaction?

If you set "returntxtemplate" to true, the transaction information will be returned without submitting the transaction to the chain. This means that the transaction will not be broadcast to the network or recorded on the blockchain.

if the transaction is sent from the currency ID of a centralized currency, this creates new currency to send

3. "minconf"         (numeric, optional, default=1) only use funds confirmed at least this many times.
4. "feeamount"        (numeric, optional) specific fee amount requested instead of default miner's fee.
5. "returntxtemplate     (boolean, optional, default false) if true, returns transaction info without submitting the transaction to the chain.
